item.title: With the #Campersites contribution theme on #MapComplete, there is now an even easier way for #campers to contribute #OpenStreetMap data related to places to sleep, to dump waste, to get provisions, etc.: https://mapcomplete.osm.be/campersite. (Via #OSM Diaries: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/joost%20schouppe/diary/396150)

Of course, it’s not unexpected that a map of sea #beacons makes continent outlines visible (it’s what they’re for, after all). What is fascinating is there is enough #OpenStreetMap data to make a map so accurately detailed. And a colorful and visually pleasing result. http://beacons.schmirler.de/en/world.html#map=5/45.4930870127121/1.2637796167170645&layers=OS9&details=18 #beaconmap (Via #WeeklyOSM: weeklyosm.eu/archives/14363)

You won’t have to fly to Buenos Aires to attend this year’s #FOSS4G event (Free and Open Source Software for #Geospatial), as it will take place online from 27 September to 2 October 2021: https://2021.foss4g.org. (Via #WeeklyOSM: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14363)

#OpenStreetCam plugin becomes #KartaView and integrates new visualisation feature, including 360° images, in #JOSM: https://blog.improveosm.org/en/2021/03/openstreetcam-plugin-becomes-kartaview-and-integrates-new-visualisation-feature/. #OpenStreetMap (Via #WeeklyOSM: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14363)
The #OpenStreetMap Belgium Mapper of the Month #MotM series goes international this month to interview Gustavo Soares from Brazil: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/03/09/gustavo-soares.html

#OSMQueries is a website with a collection of #Overpass API query tutorials. You’ll learn: * basics of the #OpenStreetMap data model * to extract nodes, ways and relations using different methods * to filter data to extract just the features of interest * to write spatial queries to find features within specific areas or within proximity * to output data as CSV and JSON https://blog.ldodds.com/2021/03/06/osm-queries/
#Geotrivia - Name countries that have territory on multiple continents: https://blog.opencagedata.com/post/geotrivia-feb2021-multicontinent-countries. #fridaygeotrivia

Soon, the 100,000,000th changeset will be published in #OpenStreetMap. The counter tool (https://jwestman.gitlab.io/osm-in-realtime/) shows the progression in real time. And #WeeklyOSM (http://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14269) is offering an interview and a present to the contributor lucky to hit the milestone.
The #OpenStreetMap Belgium Mapper of the Month #MotM series continues. This month, let’s meet lhennen: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/02/03/lhennen.html.

What are the weirdest and most original usecases of #OpenStreeetMap ? Discover them or add your own to the thread: https://www.reddit.com/r/openstreetmap/comments/l18hs8/query_what_are_the_weirdest_and_most_original/

Interesting report on the use of Free and Open Source Software #FOSS by the #OpenStreetMap Foundation #OSMF: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/xamanu/diary/395615. And #kudos to @rory for leading the pack on #Mastodon with the #OSM-oriented https://en.osm.town instance! What hosted or self-hosted alternatives would you suggest they use ?

Video “How to create a toolbar preset in #JOSM, so you can apply your own tags in one click”: https://peertube.openstreetmap.fr/videos/watch/cb6275ba-204e-49e8-88ed-e8e56de6d2bb Summary: Click “Presets” menu > “Create Presets”, then right-click the toolbar and customize it to add the preset as a button. #OpenStreetMap #tips

Tips for working on #MapRoulette tasks in your preferred area: - Nearby Tasks - Virtual Challenges Read more: https://blog.maproulette.org/2021/01/25/tips-for-solving-tasks-in-a-small-area/ #OpenStreetMap #tips

#OpenStreetMap State of the Map 2021 #SotM will again take place as a virtual conference later this year. Meanwhile, calling to creative to creative minds to create the event logo: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2021/01/24/call-for-state-of-the-map-2021-logo-designs/.

The #OpenStreetMap Foundation Board #OSMF launched the 2021 #OSM Survey to know what the community thinks about what the Foundation did last year and what do you think the Foundation should focus on for this year and in the future: https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2021-January/085953.html. Make yourself heard.
Are you looking forward to next #OpenStreetMap State of the Map #SotM ? #OSMF is calling for help to organize it: https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2021-January/085938.html.

#FOSDEM 2021 (online event this year) is approaching (Sat-Sun, Feb 6-7) and has, among a much broader agenda, talks on geo-related data, free and open source geospatial software and its ecosystem. Check the talk abstracts at https://fosdem.org/2021/schedule/track/geospatial/. #GIS #OpenStreetMap
Let's meet Jorisbo, Mapper of the Month #MotM from OpenStreetMap Belgium: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/01/11/jorisbo.html

9 #Decentralized, #P2P and Open Source alternatives to mainstream social media platforms like #Twitter, #Facebook, #YouTube and #Reddit: #Minds, #Aether, #Mastodon, #Lbry, #KArma, #Peertube, #Diaspora, #Dtube, and #Signal. Also cited: #MeWe #Voice. https://itsfoss.com/mainstream-social-media-alternaives/ #itsfoss

Call for volunteers. The #OpenStreetMap Foundation Board of Directors #OSMF wishes to proceed with creation of a Software Dispute Resolution Panel made up of volunteer Foundation members who will resolve software disputes around OpenStreetMap-focused software. https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/osmf-talk/2021-January/007639.html
